acronyms.definition: A2 Certificate of Competency - A qualification allowing drone pilots to fly closer to people in the A2 subcategory
Air Accidents Investigation Branch - The UK agency responsible for investigating aviation accidents and incidents
Above Ground Level - Height measured from the surface directly below the aircraft
Above Mean Sea Level - Height measured from sea level
Air Navigation Order - The primary UK legislation governing aviation operations
Air Traffic Control - Service providing information and control to aircraft to ensure safe separation
Attitude Mode - Flight mode where the drone maintains its orientation but may drift without GPS position hold
British Model Flying Association - UK organization representing model aircraft enthusiasts
Beyond Visual Line of Sight - Operating a drone when the pilot cannot see it directly
Civil Aviation Authority - The UK's independent aviation regulator
Civil Aviation Publication - Official guidance documents published by the CAA
Centre of Gravity - The point where the aircraft's weight is considered to be concentrated
Drone and Model Aircraft Registration and Education Service - CAA's online registration system
European Union Aviation Safety Agency - EU body that develops aviation safety regulations
European Commission Regulation 785/2004 - Sets insurance requirements for aircraft including drones
Electromagnetic Field - Can interfere with drone navigation systems and control links
Flight Management System - Automated system for planning and executing flight paths
First Person View - Flying using a video feed from the aircraft's camera
Flight Restriction Zone - Areas where drone flights are prohibited or restricted
General Data Protection Regulation - EU regulation governing personal data processing
Global Positioning System - Satellite navigation system providing location and time information
General VLOS Certificate - Authorization for specific beyond visual line of sight operations
Inertial Measurement Unit - Device measuring aircraft orientation and movement using accelerometers and gyroscopes
Lithium Polymer - Type of rechargeable battery commonly used in drones
Meteorological Aerodrome Report - Standardized weather report format used in aviation
Maximum Take-Off Mass - The maximum weight at which an aircraft is certified to take off
National Air Traffic Services - UK's main air traffic control provider
Notice to Air Missions - Official notice of temporary hazards or changes in airspace
Pilot in Command - The pilot responsible for the operation and safety of the aircraft
Remote Identification - System broadcasting drone identification and position information
Remote Pilot in Command - Pilot responsible for safely operating a remotely piloted aircraft
Return to Home - Automated function that flies the drone back to its take-off point
Standard Operating Procedure - Documented process for conducting operations safely and consistently
Terminal Aerodrome Forecast - Weather forecast for a specific airport or area
Threat and Error Management - Safety framework for identifying and managing operational risks
Take-Off and Landing Area - Designated safe area for aircraft operations
Unmanned Aircraft System - Complete system including the drone, control station, and data links
Unmanned Aerial Vehicle - The aircraft component of a UAS (drone)
Coordinated Universal Time - Standard time reference used in aviation worldwide
Visual Line of Sight - Operating a drone while maintaining direct visual contact with it
Visual Observer - Person assisting the pilot by maintaining visual contact with the drone
Vortex Ring State - Dangerous aerodynamic condition where aircraft descends into its own downwash
Web Content Accessibility Guidelines - Standards for making digital content accessible to people with disabilities
